docs.snippet: THE League of Nations came into being officially on Jan. 10, 1920.  At that time ratifications of the Treaty of Versailles were deposited at Paris, and the treaty,  together with the covenant of the League, became effective.
docs.lead_paragraph: THE League of Nations came into being officially on Jan. 10, 1920. At that time ratifications of the Treaty of Versailles were deposited at Paris, and the treaty, together with the covenant of the League, became effective.

headline.main: LEAGUE OF NATIONS' WORK; Actual Accomplishments Since It Came Into Being Officially on Jan. 10 The Council. The Assembly. The Secretariat. Court of International Justice. International Labor Conference. International Labor Office. International Health Office. Disarmament. Freedom at Communications and Transit. Minorities. Mandates. The Saar Valley. Danzig. International Financial Conference. Commission of Inquiry on Russia. The Official Journal. The Budget of the League.
'DRY' CAMPAIGN IN URUGUAY; Congress Sanctions Law Utilizing Schools to Spread Prohibition Sentiment.

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, May 16.--Exports of American textiles to Argentina increased fiftyfold between 1913 and 1918, says Trade Commissioner L.S. Gary, in a report submitted to the Bureau of Foreign and Domestic Commerce on the textiles markets of Argentina,...
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, May 16.--Exports of American textiles to Argentina increased fiftyfold between 1913 and 1918, says Trade Commissioner L.S. Gary, in a report submitted to the Bureau of Foreign and Domestic Commerce on the textiles markets of Argentina, Uruguay and Paraguay.
docs.abstract: Reports big increase in textile exports to Argentina

headline.main: BIG RISE IN TEXTILE TRADE TO ARGENTINA; Foreign Commerce Bureau Reports Fiftyfold Increase in Exports from 1913 to 1918.YEARLY SALES $18,000,000Latins Find Our Fabrics Well Madeand Well Designed, but Complain of Service.

byline.original: Special to The New York Times

docs.snippet: In the second decade of the nineteenth century, when Ferdinand VII.  of Spain destroyed the constitutional regime and restored the absolute monarchy, there was, so people say, a very wretched actor playing in a comedy theatre in Madrid.
docs.lead_paragraph: In the second decade of the nineteenth century, when Ferdinand VII. of Spain destroyed the constitutional regime and restored the absolute monarchy, there was, so people say, a very wretched actor playing in a comedy theatre in Madrid.

headline.main: IBANEZ TELLS WHAT'S WRONG WITH MEXICO; Chiefly a Brand of Militarism Based On Disorder and Thriving on Loot. GUNMEN IN THE SADDLE Represented by Boy Generals Scarcely of Voting Age but Handy with the Pistol. THE UNIVERSAL REVOLVER And Metallic Undervest of Cartridges--Wanted a Public OpinionThat Will End Rule of the Gun.

docs.snippet: The Mexican capital is a city of gloom.  In daytime, under a dazzling sun and a sky of deep blue, it has movement and animation.
docs.lead_paragraph: The Mexican capital is a city of gloom. In daytime, under a dazzling sun and a sky of deep blue, it has movement and animation.

headline.main: LONG NIGHTMARE OF MEXICAN MISRULE; Gloom in the Capital Tells the Story of the Country's Suffering. GAIETY ENDED WITH DIAZ Good Men in Exile and Their Looted Possessions Openly Flaunted by the Thieves. THE SLANDERED ZAPATISTAS And Villistas--Carranza's Trusted Leaders, Now in Power, Are Feared Far Worse.

byline.original: By V. BLASCO IBANEZ, Anchor of "The Four Horsemen of the Apocalypse." Copyright, 1920, by V. Blasco Ibanez. III.--MEXICO'S SORROW

docs.snippet: The politicians of the Mexican revolution know knothing about the United States. They have never, as a rule, been outside their own country.
docs.lead_paragraph: The politicians of the Mexican revolution know knothing about the United States. They have never, as a rule, been outside their own country.

headline.main: WHY AMERICA FAILS IN MEXICAN AFFAIRS; Ibanez Analyzes Recent Relations from Our Point ofView and Theirs.VAST MEXICAN IGNORANCEOf the Outside World Even in This Hemisphere and Despite a Common Tongue.OUR OWN SAD MISTAKESThe Climax Coming When the NewRegime Seeks Financial Aid, WhichIt Must Have to Hold On.
